critique: The document is an executive order transferring power to the Chairman of the War Production Board. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the war effort is being managed effectively. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming to convey competence and control. There is an element of surprise in the transfer of power, but it is likely intended to be a calculated move rather than a shocking event. There is no explicit mention of joy, sadness, anger, fear, or disgust.
